Hamad's Story

Click Anywhere to Continue

I came into my classroom on the first day of school. Everyone was sitting down. The teacher, Miss Hissa welcomed me and told the class “Today a new student is joining us, his name is Hamad. Class what do we say to Hamad?” Everyone: Welcome to our class Hamad. With heavy steps, I went to my seat.

The bell rang, class ended, and a boy came up to me. His name is Khalid. He asked: “How are you Hamad? I didn’t answer. Another boy joined, Faisal, he asked me “Is your house close to school?” I was very reluctant to answer. I simply nodded with my head to say yes. They asked more questions, but I answered without speaking a word.

During recess, I noticed Khalid and Faisal whispering with the others. It seemed they are about to head some place. I followed them, until we reached the school playground. Each took a spot and they started to pick their teams. I waited for my turn until I was left alone and they started to kick the ball and start the game.

I didn’t understand why they didn’t pick me. Is it because Im the new student?

Quiz Challenge

Answer this question

In the school lunchroom my class mates sat in groups. I went by all the groups hoping that one group would ask me to join them. However I didn’t find any seats around them. I sat far away. I eat my food while seeing them all chat and laugh.

In the art room I made beautiful paintings. I love reading stories. They taught me how to tell stories and create their characters. Even though it’s true that no one joined me in any activity today, however I love my hobbies, and I’m happy with what I accomplished.

In the following day, a student came in class. Miss Hissa welcomed him saying: “ Today a new student is joining us, his name is Hasan. Class what do we say to Hasan?” Everyone: Welcome to our class Hasan! I told myself “Great! Hasan is the new student. I won’t be the new student anymore! I’ll be friends with everyone now.”

Quiz Challenge 2

Answer this question

It wasn’t as I expected. Hasan quickly became everyones friend. They all chatted together and played together. He joined them in the lunchroom, while I stayed alone. “Why” I wondered. “Do they think I’m boring or shy or can’t be a friend?”.

In the art room, I painted a large ship that had all my classmates in it. Hasan came up to me and admired my painting. I was worried I wouldn’t answer him with words if he asked me anything. I was surprised when he Hasan used sign language to ask me “Why are you not in the ship with us?”. I replied with sign language “How did you know?”. Hasan said “from the hearing aid you’re wearing.”

He explained that he learned sign language since his younger sister also uses a hearing aid. He encouraged to speak more. I answered “But I thpeek with difficulty” (meaning I speak with difficulty). Hasan assured me that it was clear enough, and asked that It’ll be ok to speak more verbally with the others too.

Hasan asked if I would join him for the class activity tomorrow. We must create teams of three. Each team is to act out a story for the rest of the class. At first I was nervous to say yes. In the end I was convinced to push myself and try something I’m not used to. Our team was Hasan, Jamal, and myself.

We gathered items to help us tell the story. With my art skills I created our costumes from cutout cardboard and painted them. When it was our turn, the class laughed and cheered. They learned about my skills, my love for story telling, and my special way of speaking. They love what we did, and the whole class and Miss Hessa all clapped for us.

Before going into the lunchroom the following day I thought “will I be their friend, or will I stay the new student?”. After some thinking I went in, I asked Hasan “ Can I thit with you?” (meaning: Can I sit with you?) He replied “Ofcourse!”. Then I heard another group call me to sit with them. I smiled and thanked them.

When it was time for recess, I was playing ball with my classmates. At that moment, I realized that we might never get to know each other if we don't initiate contact.

Be yourself whoever accepts you, will accept you
